intro: Holacantha emoryi, commonly known as the Emory's holacantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Holacantha in the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Holacantha emoryi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
